Letter 14

May 23, 2019

Notes from Summer: I AM A GRADUAAAAAATEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!! Slowly, piece by piece, each part of my identity has fallen away these past few weeks. Time to embrace my non-studentship.

Notes from Jillian: I don‚Äôt have anything going on in my life that tops the fact that Summer graduated, let‚Äôs be real. I love her so much and I am so, so proud of her. Now give her a job.

üì± Cute-ify your calendar

First of all, if you‚Äôre not using a calendar app to schedule your entire life, what are you doing? Second of all, yes I am a Virgo rising. So here‚Äôs the thing: you are not required to use the default colors in whatever calendar app you‚Äôre using. You‚Äôre allowed to pick colors that are pleasing to look at and don‚Äôt fill you with a sense of dread every time you look at your schedule. Go through every calendar you have (I have 20+ but that‚Äôs another story), figure out how to change the color of it (here are instructions for Apple Calendar and Google Calendar), and pick one that you like. My calendar is mostly light pinks and purples‚Äîhighly recommend.

üìΩÔ∏è Detective Pikachu

THIS MOVIE IS SO GOOD. Ok, full disclosure: it is absolutely for its audience, and that audience is me and other children. However. Despite its target audience, Detective Pikachu respects what children are capable of handling, unlike other pieces of Pokemon media (the anime, sorry, I love it on principle, but). It‚Äôs not a dark & gritty reboot of all of the other things we liked in our youth, too, which is refreshing. Seeing Pokemon in real life is magical & I absolutely did cry real tears when a group of bulbasaur had their moment.

‚Äì Summer

üì∫ Veep

Uhhhhhhh Game of Thrones who? Sorry but the Veep finale is the only series finale I will accept. I‚Äôm going to miss Veep so much, but it truly couldn‚Äôt have gotten a better ending. If you want to watch a show that is brilliant and hilarious from start to finish, Veep is that show. I don‚Äôt have anything else to say about it, just please watch it. Trust me on this.
